title: Announcement of Appointments to the White House Office of Intergovernmental Affairs
summary: This announcement details the appointment of Alex Meyer as the Deputy Assistant to the President and Director of the White House Office of Intergovernmental Affairs. Before this role, Meyer worked as the Deputy Political Director for the Trump-Vance 2024 Campaign, where he was responsible for managing campaign operations in key battleground states such as Georgia, North Carolina, and Pennsylvania, contributing to the campaign's overall success in those regions.

title: Memorandum on Increasing Transparency in Government Spending
summary: This memorandum addresses concerns regarding government expenditures on programs, contracts, and grants that are perceived to not align with the interests of the American public. It emphasizes the need for improved transparency and accountability in how taxpayer money is allocated, specifically highlighting issues related to funding for both domestic and international projects that may not serve favorable outcomes for American taxpayers. The memorandum calls for heads of executive departments and agencies to actively engage in ensuring that federal spending is more closely monitored and aligned with the interests of the populace.

title: Commemoration of George Washington's Birthday, 2025
summary: This proclamation marks the birthday of George Washington, the first President of the United States. It serves to recognize his contributions to the nation and his role as a foundational figure in American history. The proclamation highlights Washington's legacy and the values he embodied, reaffirming the significance of his leadership and commitment to the principles of freedom and governance.

title: Emergency Declaration for the Commonwealth of Kentucky Due to Severe Weather Events
summary: On February 14, 2025, President Donald J. Trump declared a state of emergency in the Commonwealth of Kentucky in response to severe storms, straight-line winds, flooding, and landslides that began affecting the region. This declaration enables federal assistance to support state and local response efforts to address the emergency conditions resulting from the severe weather. The action facilitates coordination and resource allocation for recovery and support measures as necessary.

title: Establishment of the National Energy Dominance Council
summary: This executive order establishes the National Energy Dominance Council, an entity aimed at promoting the development and utilization of the United States' natural resources and energy technologies. The Council is tasked with coordinating policies and strategies that support energy production and innovation, which are deemed essential for the nation's economic growth and security. The order emphasizes the importance of maintaining a robust energy sector in the face of global competition.
